body_html:
CMake didn't have officially FIndMKL, I think use MKL_ROOT is enough.

Use the functions provided by cmake as much as possible because that there is not only msvc compiler on windows.

For example, if you use Intel compiler on windows, you need use /Qopenmp to enable OpenMP; it is different from msvc or gnu-compliant compiler.

I have successfully built tensorflow on windows using the intel compiler. I think it is also possible to build tensorflow on windows by gcc in MSYS2 or clang for windows.

CMake didn't have officially FIndMKL, I think use MKL_ROOT is enough.

Use the functions provided by cmake as much as possible because that there is not only msvc compiler on windows.

For example, if you use Intel compiler on windows, you need use /Qopenmp to enable OpenMP; it is different from msvc or gnu-compliant compiler.

I have successfully built tensorflow on windows using the intel compiler. I think it is also possible to build tensorflow on windows by gcc in MSYS2 or clang for windows.
